definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: To develop teaching skills for reading elementary and intermediate level Braille music.
sentences.chinese: 課程結束後能夠教導盲生閱讀初級和中級點字音樂。

sentences.english: Please move cursor on Braille to navigate this site.
sentences.chinese: 請把滑鼠移向點字，以瀏覽更多網站內容。

sentences.english: To acquire the ability to read Braille music at an elementary and intermediate level.
sentences.chinese: 課程結束後學生能夠閱讀初級點字樂譜的能力。

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
